poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text:
That's not a plume pine cone, it's a pigeon, headless;
Might be the bird I saw on a mosaic
Waddle as if it had all day
T dae wht doos'll do. But
Elijah's fiery charabang gone west.
A dray of solar panelling on the sky
Empowers what the giant screens envision.
Believe it.
